video.title: Computer Basics 8: Types of Computers
video.description:
http://FreeCodeCamp.com is a community of busy people who learn to code, then practice by building projects for nonprofits. Learn Full-stack JavaScript, build a portfolio, and get great references with our open source community.

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/intent/user?screen_name=freecodecamp

Follow us on Twitch: twitch.tv/freecodecamp

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/freecodecamp

Follow Quincy on Quora: http://www.quora.com/Quincy-Larson

 
  This video covers the basics of supercomputers, servers, workstations, PCs, and microcontrollers.
  Let's discuss the different types of computers.
  The biggest type is called a super computer, a computer with lots of CPUS that work on the same problem at the same time using a technique called parallel processing.
  The next type is called a server.
  A server holds and accesses lots of data or programs.
  Free Code Camp is hosted on a server which stores all of that information.
  Let's talk now about a workstation computer - a computer that may look similar to a personal computer, but has a lot more power and is a lot pricier.
  Toy Story was built on workstation computers.
  Now, personal computers are by far the most common.
  Maybe you've heard \I'm a Mac!\ or \I'm a PC!\ something indicating they're different, but really my own personal MacBook is still a PC, a personal compter.
  It's both a Mac and a PC.
  The last type of computer we'll talk about is a microcontroller, the type of computer you might have in your car that is really good at a small specialized task, but wouldn't be used the same way a PC would be.

topLevelComment.author: B El
topLevelComment.text: what about the raspberry pi? it can be used as a PC (admittedly, a very basic one) or a microcontroller, no?

topLevelComment.author: Abdelmalek Lahmar
topLevelComment.text: can we call computer with i7 or i5 or core2duo type of super computer

replies.author: Dnouglas
replies.text: @Ho Ho Chi phones aren't like microcontrollers, because they aren't specialized to do one single tasks. Phones can do anything a computer can do, maybe in a different way or not as quickly/efficiently, but it is still technically a pc. Microcontrollers basically do one and only one task, such as home heating systems, radios, etc.

replies.author: Ho Ho Chi
replies.text: Also, you won't expect a mobile device has a 16GB RAM like a notebook or iMac contained.

replies.author: Ho Ho Chi
replies.text: @Nabil Tharwat So why aren't the mobile devices called microcontroller like the monitor using in car ?

replies.author: Nabil Tharwat
replies.text: Mobile devices are just like PCs, but just a little smaller, same components, similar performance.
